entities.name: Endless Summer
entities.description: Soviet Games made a visual novel quest game with text choices and multiple endings.

entities.name: Semyon
entities.description: The main character is a recluse from 2ch, formerly known as a "bitard." They have poor social skills and are encountered by various characters like Slavya, Lena, Ulyana, and Alya. The player chooses a male partner at the end of the route. One character, Shurik, attacks with a girl, and another is named “Sem Person.” A ward exists in Olga Dmitrievna's cabin, and one character has IIchan open on their computer.

entities.name: Soviet Games
entities.description: The developer of the visual novel "Endless Summer".

entities.name: 2ch
entities.description: Semyon's online residence.

entities.name: Bus number 410
entities.description: Semyon boards a bus that changes reality. The bus is linked to a story about hell.

entities.name: Sovyonok
entities.description: Semyon finds himself in a pioneer camp. It’s a strange place, possibly from the 1980s or a parallel dimension. The camp has an owl mascot and features Slavya. This location is linked to conflict and spirits within the game's world.

entities.name: Camp
entities.description: Sovyonok is a location for Semyons and pioneer girls.

entities.name: District Center
entities.description: A location near the camp that can be reached in some mods.

entities.name: Moscow 2 Bunker
entities.description: A bunker where the prototype of Sovyonok was located.

entities.name: Volga Camp
entities.description: The prototype for the Sovyonok camp, with detailed photographs available.

entities.name: Pioneer Girls
entities.description: Local girls at the camp whom the player can potentially start a relationship with.

entities.name: Routes
entities.description: Paths in the game determined by player choices, leading to different story branches with varying endings.

entities.name: Heroines
entities.description: Characters associated with specific routes.

entities.name: Mini-games
entities.description: Interactive elements within the game, including a card tournament.

entities.name: Locations
entities.description: Specific areas or places within the game world; 20 locations are present (excluding those before arriving at 'Sovyonok').

entities.name: Pioneer
entities.description: The character resembles Semyon. A suspicious person appeared at the camp. They are a camp member.

entities.name: Yulia
entities.description: The character appears with the Pioneer in her ending. She is a neko-girl guardian of "Sovyonok" in the catacombs. The protagonist created YuVao-chan. This is a cat-girl character from LHC Inc. She tried to talk to Shurik in dark tunnels.

entities.name: The Maker
entities.description: Creator of "Sovyonok" and the Pioneer.

entities.name: Slavya
entities.description: The woman keeps order at the camp and meets Semyon at the gate. She is a kind heroine with her own story. She lives with Zhenya in a room, and she also lives in a cabin.

entities.name: Slavya-chan
entities.description: The Ichchan mascot represents Slavic culture. It was created in 2007 and gained popularity.

entities.name: Orchid
entities.description: The musical theme associated with the character.

entities.name: Lena
entities.description: Alya knows a shy, depressed person named Lenka. Lenka is often pranked by Alya and is a childhood acquaintance. There's an inscription saying "Lenka is stupid." Alya saw someone reading “Gone with the Wind.”

entities.name: Unyl-chan
entities.description: The mascot that inspired Lena's creation, created in 2007.

entities.name: Ulyana
entities.description: The "USSR Girl" is a hyperactive, prank-loving friend of Alya. She lives in a cabin and resembles Miku.

entities.name: Lenin
entities.description: The historical figure whose surname is the basis for Ulyana’s name.

entities.name: Ulyanov
entities.description: Lenin’s real surname, used as the origin of Ulyana's name.

entities.name: USSR-chan
entities.description: A 2ch mascot created in 2006 that influenced Ulyana’s design.

entities.name: Dvach-chan
entities.description:
*   A mascot is more popular than USSR-chan.
*   This mascot inspired Alya.
*   The mascot has a side called Krippi-chan.

entities.name: Alya
entities.description:
Ulyana has a friend in the cabin. 
She punches Semyon.
She is a passionate musician, especially with guitar.
Electronic fears her.
She lives in a cabin.

entities.name: Counselor
entities.description: Ulyana often gets in trouble with character Banhammer-chan. She is the prototype for Banhammer-chan.

entities.name: She
entities.description: The main subject of the text, involved in relationships with other characters.

entities.name: Miku
entities.description: She is the founder of a music club. Alya talks to her. She is friendly and hyperactive. She is the main heroine in a horror route. Her comment is on the music club board.

entities.name: Krippi-chan
entities.description: A character featured in some modifications, does not appear in the game.

entities.name: That’s Our Madhouse
entities.description: The musical theme for Krippi-chan.

entities.name: Miku Hatsune
entities.description: The Japanese virtual singer that served as the basis for Miku's character.

entities.name: Masha
entities.description: Miku’s real name, an adaptation for the Japanese context.

entities.name: Japanese
entities.description: Miku’s mother is Japanese. She has a pack of Japanese gum.

entities.name: "So Good To Be Careless"
entities.description: Yulia's musical theme.

entities.name: IIchan mascot YuVao-chan
entities.description: A mascot character that served as the basis for Yulia's creation.

entities.name: YuVao
entities.description: Yulia's ending and a cat-girl character.

entities.name: LHC Inc.
entities.description: A bio-tech company made Yulia, a cat-girl.

entities.name: Olga Dmitrievna
entities.description:
She was a counselor for the detachment. 
She lived in a cabin.

entities.name: Viola
entities.description: There was another female staff member. She was a middle-aged nurse with different colored eyes. She also had limited screen time.

entities.name: Banhammer-chan
entities.description: Olga Dmitrievna is a 2ch mascot. It blocks unwanted users. She has a hammer from her bed. The mascot is used on graphic materials with spoilers.

entities.name: Collider-sama
entities.description: 2ch mascot prototype for Viola.

entities.name: Eternal Longing
entities.description: The character's musical theme.

entities.name: Zhenya
entities.description: The librarian is grumpy and stays at the library. She is the source of Mitsgol.

entities.name: Mitsgol
entities.description: Zhenya is a 2007 character from 2ch, inspired by Mithgol the Webmaster. He is also the basis for Mitsgël, found in Slavya's cabin.

entities.name: Electronic
entities.description: A cyberneticist is a friend of Shurik. He belongs to a cybernetics club. He reminds people of Electronic from "The Adventures of Electronic".<|im_end|>

entities.name: Syroyezhkin
entities.description: Electronic's last name, also a reference to "The Adventures of Electronic".

entities.name: Shurik
entities.description: The friend is a hero from Soviet cinema. He loves science and builds robots with Electronic. He wears glasses like Gendo.

entities.name: Tolik
entities.description: Well-known character is in the cafeteria. He has a distorted face and draws crudely.

entities.name: Blurry Character 1
entities.description: A blurry, tired person sat to Tolik’s right. Another blurry person was in front of Tolik with a mouth drawn on their face.

entities.name: Fantômas
entities.description: A poster figure found in one of the cabins.

entities.name: bitard
entities.description: A character depicted as a poster, specifically in Semyon's cabin.

entities.name: Vasnetsov
entities.description: Artist whose paintings are displayed in Slavya's cabin.

entities.name: Detroit Metal City
entities.description: An anime hangs above Alya’s bed.

entities.name: Stalin vs. Martians
entities.description: A game whose poster hangs above Ulyana's bed.

entities.name: Alya's Cabin
entities.description: Alya's cabin. Ulyana's cabin.

entities.name: Stalin
entities.description: A figure from the game "Stalin vs. Martians"

entities.name: Gav
entities.description: A kitten

entities.name: Soviet-era hockey players
entities.description: Hockey players from the Soviet era, potentially Larionov, Krutov, Fetisov, Makarov, or Kasatonov.

entities.name: Sickle and hammer
entities.description: Drawings of a sickle and hammer

entities.name: Tsoi
entities.description: A musician from the Soviet era

entities.name: Vysotsky
entities.description: A poet from the Soviet era

entities.name: anime heroine
entities.description: An anime character

entities.name: Beatles
entities.description: The Beatles band

entities.name: Medical Center
entities.description: A facility containing medical charts and posters.

entities.name: Eye Chart
entities.description: Contains internet phrases like 'Aftar zzhesh' and 'Stsukko'.

entities.name: Vegetable Poster
entities.description: Poster referencing the 'I eat vegetables' meme.

entities.name: Alyosha (Kyshtym Dwarf)
entities.description: Skeleton belonging to a character named Alyosha.

entities.name: Gende
entities.description: Ikari Gendo is a monument. Shurik mimics his mannerisms.

entities.name: Imageboard User Gende
entities.description: Easter egg referencing an imageboard user named Gende.

entities.name: Aska
entities.description: Anime character with distinctive hairstyle.

entities.name: Rei
entities.description: Anime character with distinctive hairstyle.

entities.name: Misato
entities.description: Anime character with distinctive hairstyle.

entities.name: Vakaba Sign
entities.description: Sign appearing in the camp and on the advertising board.

entities.name: Vakaba
entities.description: Advertising board featuring the Vakaba sign.

entities.name: Syrno
entities.description: Advertising board with the Vakaba sign in the background.

entities.name: Winter Tale
entities.description: Visual novel advertised on a billboard from the bus window.

entities.name: Alya Selenzova
entities.description: Character has an Easter egg name.

entities.name: Team Fortress 2 (TF2)
entities.description: Style of suit drawing in the card tournament.

entities.name: Gone with the Wind
entities.description: Lena is reading 'Gone with the Wind'.<|im_end|>

entities.name: Spirited Away
entities.description: "Gone with the Wind" was linked to the anime "Spirited Away."

entities.name: IIchan
entities.description: Software running on Semyon's computer.

entities.name: Music Club Board
entities.description: Board with a message "Miku is stupid" written on it.

entities.name: Owls
entities.description: Birds found in various locations.

entities.name: Night Lamps
entities.description: Objects where owls are located.

entities.name: Alya and Ulyana's Cabin
entities.description: Cabin where one owl is peeking out of the window.

entities.name: Pedobear
entities.description: A teddy bear, a reference to the character's age.

entities.name: Playthrough Variants Map
entities.description: A map sourced from the internet
